alert.note: Alert for Loudoun (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 7:27PM EST until January 09 at 9:00PM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 AM EST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern Virginia, including the following county, Loudoun. * WHEN...Until 130 AM EST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 727 PM EST, Stream gauges indicated that flooding was going to occur soon along Goose Creek as well as Catoctin Creek. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 2 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to a half of an inch is possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Leesburg... Purcellville... Brunswick... Middleburg... Round Hill... Oatlands... Bluemont... Lovettsville... Hamilton... Hillsboro... Lincoln... Hughesville... Paeonian Springs... Philomont... Waterford... Neersville... Saint Louis... Aldie... Taylorstown... Lucketts... - Please visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
